name: Ubidots
description: Build your own sensor application.  Ubidots simplifies the making of Internet of Things applications for data capturing, real-time remote monitoring and getting insights from sensor data.

api_methods.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
api_methods.description: This resource list the variables of a specified data source, showing all the fields of the variables.

utterances.utterance: Can you show me the variables for the weather station data source?
I need to see all the variables associated with the smart home system.
List the variables for the industrial sensor network.
What are the variables for the environmental monitoring system?
Fetch the variables for the agricultural sensor array.
Could you provide the variables for the energy management system?
Retrieve the variables for the water quality monitoring setup.
I want to see the variables for the traffic monitoring network.
Get the variables for the air quality sensor grid.
Show me the variables for the smart city infrastructure.

api_methods.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}
api_methods.description: This resource returns a variable and its details. It shows additional fields than the ones required during the creation of the variable:  last_value: Shows the last value written to the variable.

utterances.utterance: Can you show me the details of the temperature sensor variable?
I need to check the last recorded value for the humidity sensor.
What's the latest data from the pressure sensor variable?
Please provide the details for the light intensity variable.
Fetch the information for the motion detector variable.
I'd like to see the last value for the CO2 level sensor.
Can you retrieve the details of the water flow sensor variable?
Show me the latest reading from the wind speed sensor.
Get the details for the air quality sensor variable.
I want to know the last value recorded by the soil moisture sensor.

api_methods.name: GET /variables
api_methods.description: Retrieves the list of all the variables owned by a user. The header X-Auth-Token is needed to have the permissions for this endpoint.

utterances.utterance: Can you show me all the variables I have in my account?
I need to see the list of variables associated with my user profile.
Fetch all the variables that belong to me.
What are the variables I currently own?
List all the variables under my account.
Could you retrieve the variables I have access to?
Show me the variables linked to my user.
I want to see all the variables I own.
Get the list of variables for my user account.
Display all the variables that are mine.

api_methods.name: GET /datasources
api_methods.description: This resource lists all the existing data sources of a user.

utterances.utterance: Can you show me all my data sources?
List all the data sources I have.
I need to see my existing data sources.
What are the data sources available in my account?
Display all my current data sources.
Could you provide a list of my data sources?
Show me the data sources I have set up.
I want to view all my data sources.
Give me a rundown of my data sources.
Fetch all the data sources linked to my account.

api_methods.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}
api_methods.description: This resource obtains an existing data source and its details. Also, it returns additional fields besides the ones required during the creation of the data source:  number_of_variables: Shows the number of variables contained by the data source. last_activity: Returns the date of the last activity

utterances.utterance: Can you show me the details of the weather station data source?
I need information about the data source for the smart home sensors.
Fetch the details for the industrial IoT gateway data source.
What are the details of the environmental monitoring data source?
Retrieve the data source information for the agricultural sensors.
Give me the details of the fleet management data source.
I want to see the details of the energy consumption data source.
Please provide the details for the healthcare monitoring data source.
Show me the details of the smart city infrastructure data source.
Can you retrieve the details for the logistics tracking data source?

api_methods.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}/values
api_methods.description: This resource returns the values of the specified variable.  Every value will have a timestamp which is a value in milliseconds according to the POSIX standard.

utterances.utterance: Can you show me the latest data for the temperature sensor in the greenhouse?
I need to see the recent readings from the humidity sensor in the basement.
Fetch the data values for the air quality monitor in the office.
What are the latest values recorded by the water level sensor in the reservoir?
Retrieve the recent data from the pressure sensor on the pipeline.
Can you get the latest readings from the light sensor in the laboratory?
I want to see the data from the motion detector in the hallway.
Please provide the recent values from the CO2 sensor in the conference room.
Show me the latest data from the wind speed sensor on the rooftop.
Get the current readings from the soil moisture sensor in the garden.

api_methods.name: POST /variables/{variable_id}/values
api_methods.description: This resource creates a new value within the specified variable. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.

utterances.utterance: Add a new data point to the temperature sensor variable.

Record a new measurement for the pressure variable.
Insert a new entry into the light intensity sensor data.
Please update the wind speed variable with a new value.
Add a new reading to the soil moisture sensor.
Log a new data point for the air quality index variable.

Record a new data entry for the CO2 concentration variable.
Insert a new measurement into the noise level sensor data.

api_methods.name: POST /datasources
api_methods.description: This resource creates a new data source. Every data source owns a number of variables, and has a context with different attributes. For example, a data source called “Delivery Truck” can have a attributes like {“City”: “Boston”} or {“Type”: “Truck”}.  Attributes are not meant to change dynamically over time, but to add a “relational” layer to your data sources.

api_methods.name: POST /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
api_methods.description: This resource creates a new variable within the specified data source. You can assign tags to variables (i.e. “room”, “yard”), and also properties with atributes, for example: {“Color”: “Blue”} or {“Status”: “OFF”}

api_methods.name: POST /collections/values
api_methods.description: This resource allow the create a value for multiple variables. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.
